messages.subject: my page, cited on a UK programmers' forum
messages.messageBody:
_http://www.access-programmers.co.uk/forums/archive/index.php/t-83251.html_
(http://www.access-programmers.co.uk/forums/archive/index.php/t-83251.html)

About 2/3 the way down, my main video games page is cited. The quote is
this:

The question was
"Here is a question that is pretty much on every guys mind. How do you
convince your g/f, fiance, or wife to play a video game with you?"

Part of the answer:
#4 - If you have kids, video games are probably a big part of their lives
and playing together is an important part of parenting. If she works with kids,
playing the current games is a great way to relate to them. I found this
website as a great collection of positive influences video games have on
children: _http://sandradodd.com/games/page_ (http://sandradodd.com/games/page)


Cool.

I got fan mail last week from a high school student writing a paper, too.
I'm quoting that to the end. It was called "Good Job!"





Sandra





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
